logItems.Message: - #          Rule: Vericom/UFE compilation must pass without errors on expected model and Verdi must be able to load the IP design

- #   Description: In this rule, the tool should check for any compilation errors for various libraries in the report file generated by ACE using [-cd|-cod|-ccd|-ccod] switches.
	Algorithm:
	1.	By default the tool should check for the presence of the ACE Verdi compilation report under <IP>/tools/reports/<IP>_verdi_comp.log
	2.	With a Key override "aceverdicomplog" the user can point to a different path of the compilation report file
	3.	Then tool should check for following error messages:
	* Check for whether this is indeed Verdi report. For this check for "export NOVAS_RC" text in the log file
	* Check for library compilation failures. Check for "FAIL" text in the log file
	* Check for any gmake errors. Check for "gmake: .*Error.*" text in the log file

- #     Algorithm: For vericom:
	Locate the Verdi log file
	Make sure the log file exists
	Make sure the log file contains 'export NOVAS_RC'
	Make sure the log file does not contain FAIL or EXIT
	For ufe:
	Locate the vcs log file
	Make sure the log file exists
	Make sure the log file contains 0 errors
	Verdi directory = verdirptdir
	Verdi log file = aceverdilogfile
	ufe directory = ufedir
	ufe log file = ufevcslogfile
	check vericom = vericom
	vheck ufe = ufe
- Parameter: ufe (Are you running ufe?) : False
- Parameter: vericom (Are you running vericom?) : True
- Parameter: verdirptdir (Path to Verdi reports directory) : /nfs/sc/disks/sdg74_0279/kcorrell/rcfwl-18ww37c/tools/reports
- Parameter: aceverdilogfile (Verdi log file) : rcfwl_dft_reset_sync\..*\.verdi\..*\.log, dft_reset_sync\..*\.verdi\..*\.log
- #          Rule: Emulation RTL must pass VCS Compile (including Elaboration)

- #   Description: This is VCS Model Build of Emulation RTL. The intent of this rule is to ensure VCS successfully compiles and elaborates on emulation "view" of RTL.
	
	ACE VCS compilation (using EmulationSim filter) must be clean (log file does not contain FAIL or EXIT.
	
	To enable emulation view of RTL, add/remove following RTL Global Macros:
	Expected macros: INTEL_EMULATION, INTEL_SIMONLY (equivalent to VCS, used to protect UPF package so must be present), INTEL_NO_PWR_PINS (only if doing power-aware Emulation), INTEL_INST_ON
	Disallowed macros: INTEL_NO_PWR_PINS (if NOT doing power-aware Emulation), INTEL_FPGA, INTEL_DC
	
	
	Visit http://goto/effm for details, OR email effm_support@eclists.intel.com for any questions or help in compliance of this rule.

- #     Algorithm: Locate the VCS log file
	Make sure the log file exists & contains 'export SYNOPSYS_SIM_SETUP'.
	Make sure the log file does not contain FAIL or EXIT.
	VCS log file: aceemulvcslogfile.
	VCS directory: rtlrptdir
	Override key for Ace Emulation VCS log file = aceemulvcslogfile
- Parameter: rtlrptdir (Path to VCS reports directory) : /nfs/sc/disks/sdg74_0279/kcorrell/rcfwl-18ww37c/target/log

- #          Rule: FPGA RTL  must pass VCS Compile (including Elaboration)

- #   Description: This is VCS Model Build of FPGA RTL. The intent of this rule is to ensure VCS successfully compiles and elaborates on FPGA "view" of RTL.
	
	ACE VCS compilation (using FPGASim filter) must be clean (log file does not contain FAIL or EXIT)
	
	To enable FPGA view of RTL, add/remove following RTL Global Macros:
	Expected macros: INTEL_FPGA, INTEL_SIMONLY (equivalent to VCS, used to protect UPF package so must be present), INTEL_NO_PWR_PINS (only if doing power-aware Emulation), INTEL_INST_ON
	Disallowed macros: INTEL_NO_PWR_PINS (if NOT doing power-aware Emulation), INTEL_EMULATION, INTEL_DC
	
	
	Visit http://goto/effm for details, OR email effm_support@eclists.intel.com for any questions or help in compliance of this rule.

	Override key for Ace VCS FPGA log file = acefpgavcslogfile

The results need to be saved as "QuestionnaireExport_*.xlsx" in the RTL drop under the "$model_root/doc".  The wildcard "*" should be replaced with the name of the IP.  Zircon will verify if this file exist for compliance.
	
	If the architecture has changed after the SRA tool was executed, then the SRA tool will need to be executed again so the assessment is performed on the new architectural changes.  Additionally, the results in the "$model_root/doc" folder will need to be updated with the new SRA results.
- #     Algorithm: Zircon checks the RTL drop for the file "QuestionnaireExport_*.xlsx" in folder <model_root>/doc. If Zircon finds the file and the file is not 0 bytes, then the rule passes.
/nfs/sc/disks/sdg74_0279/kcorrell/rcfwl-18ww37c/doc/QuestionnaireExport_cdc_wrapper.xlsx -  SRA output file is not of 0 bytes
- #          Rule: Architecture security review (SDL S1) completed according to the results of the SRA and the security section in the HAS updated accordingly

- #   Description: S1 of the Security Development Lifecycle (SDL) is the "Architectural Review" of the product. For milestone summary and activity list, please visit: https://sp2010.amr.ith.intel.com/sites/sdl/Pages/Lists/Activities.aspx and under "SDL Milestone" filter, select "S1".
	
	In order to meet compliance for this rule, please complete the following steps:
	1.	Review the evidence of the activities listed in the S1 phase of the SDL with your Product Security Assurance Team (PSAT) or your organization's Security Champion (https://sp2010.amr.ith.intel.com/sites/sdl/Pages/Lists/Security-Champion-List.aspx).  If you have difficulties identifying who to contact, please reach out to Dhinesh Manoharan (dhinesh.manoharan@intel.com).
	2.	Please document the results of the review in step#1 by completing a governance ticket called "Security Zircon Rules Evidence Template.txt" located here: https://sharepoint.amr.ith.intel.com/sites/SourceDocs/Templates/Forms/AllItems.aspx 
	3.	Rename the ticket "S1_results_Security_Zircon_Rules_Evidence.txt" and save it in the RTL drop under the folder "$model_root/doc".  Zircon will verify if this file exists and the mandatory fields are completed for compliance.

- #     Algorithm: Zircon will check the RTL drop for the file "S1_results_Security_Zircon_Rules_Evidence.txt" in the "$model_root/doc" folder.  Zircon will fail the rule if the following are true:
	-	The file does not exist and the rule is not marked N/A.
	-	The file does not have the required fields completed.  The required fields are labeled as such in the document.
	-	The file does not have acceptance approval (i.e. Acceptance approved: "yes")
- INFO -Architecture security review completed according to the SDL activities listed from the SRA for S1 and updated the security section in HAS
- Waiver justification: no verification collateral, testing is done at chassis
